title: TC001-Authentication enforcement for /painel routes
description: Verify that unauthenticated users are blocked from accessing any route under /painel and redirected to login or blocked from content access.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/painel", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Check if the preview server at http://localhost:5173 is running and accessible before retrying navigation.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Set localStorage key isAuthenticated to true, then click 'Área Administrativa' to verify access to /painel.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Área Administrativa' link to navigate to /painel
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/header/div/div[2]/div/a[6]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Set localStorage key isAuthenticated to true and navigate to /painel to verify access.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Set localStorage key isAuthenticated to true, then click 'Área Administrativa' to verify access to /painel.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Área Administrativa' link to navigate to /painel
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/header/div/div[2]/div/a[6]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Set localStorage key isAuthenticated to true, then navigate to /painel and verify access is granted.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Access Denied: Please login to continue').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test failed: Unauthenticated users are not properly blocked from accessing /painel or redirected to login as required by the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC002-HomeEditor saves content and persists to Supabase
description: Ensure that editing content in HomeEditor and triggering saveHomeData correctly persists data to Supabase and updates immediately on public-facing site.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/painel", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input email and password, then click login button to log in and navigate to /painel/home
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@example.com')
        

        # -> Retry login by clicking Entrar button again or check for error messages
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to retry login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Clear password input field, re-enter password, and click Entrar button to attempt login again
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Clear password input field
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-enter password in password input field
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('adminpassword')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try to navigate manually to /painel/home to check if login session is active or if access is possible
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/painel/home', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Retry login with correct credentials or check if there is a different login method or page to access painel home
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('adminpassword')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to log in
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Content saved successfully in Supabase').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Editing content in HomeEditor and triggering saveHomeData did not persist data to Supabase or update the public-facing site as expected.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC003-FooterEditor content edit and persistence
description: Validate editing and saving footer content through FooterEditor correctly updates Supabase and the public site footer.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/painel", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input email and password, then click login button to authenticate
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('testuser@example.com')
        

        # -> Click login button to authenticate and proceed to /painel/footer
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click login button to authenticate
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Fill password input correctly and click login button again to authenticate and proceed to /painel/footer
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('testpassword')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click login button to authenticate
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Footer content updated successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The footer content was not updated in the Supabase app_content table or did not reflect on the public site footer as expected.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/painel", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input email and password, then click Entrar to log into admin painel and navigate to Ministries section
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input admin email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@example.com')
        

        # -> Click on 'Ministérios' button to navigate to Ministries section
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Ministérios' button to navigate to Ministries section
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/header/div/nav/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on the 'Área Administrativa' link to access the admin area for ministries
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Área Administrativa' link to access admin area for ministries
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/header/div/div[2]/div/a[6]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click 'Entrar' button to log in and access admin painel Ministries section
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Entrar' button to submit login form and log in
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Re-input password correctly and click 'Entrar' button to log in
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input admin password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('adminpassword')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Entrar' button to submit login form and log in
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click 'Entrar' button to submit login form and access admin painel Ministries section
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Entrar' button to submit login form and log in
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Ministry content saved successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test plan execution failed: Creating, editing, deleting ministry content entries via MinistryEditor and persisting via saveMinistry did not complete successfully. The expected confirmation message 'Ministry content saved successfully' was not found on the page, indicating failure in persistence or reflection on public ministry pages.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)

        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/painel", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)

        except async_api.Error:

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well

        frame = context.pages[-1]

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/painel", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input email and password to login to painel.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@example.com')
        

        # -> Retry login or check for login error messages.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to retry login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Re-input password correctly and submit login form again.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('adminpassword')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)

        # -> Try to clear the email and password fields and re-input credentials carefully, then submit login form again.

        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Clear password field
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]

title: TC007-LocalStorage key isAuthenticated persistence and behavior on reload
description: Test that isAuthenticated key in localStorage is required and respected for session persistence on page reload and route changes.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/painel", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input email and password, then click the login button to log in and confirm isAuthenticated is set in localStorage.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('testuser@example.com')
        

        # -> Click the login button to submit credentials and attempt login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the login button to submit credentials and attempt login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Fill the password field correctly and click the login button again to attempt login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid password to pass form validation
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('password123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the login button to submit login form after filling password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Access Granted: Session Persisted')).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test failed: The 'isAuthenticated' key in localStorage is required and respected for session persistence on page reload and route changes, but the expected access persistence was not observed.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC008-Admin UI responsiveness and cross-browser consistency
description: Verify that all admin painel UI components (layouts, navigation, editors) render and function correctly across different screen sizes and major browsers.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/painel", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input email and password, then click the login button to access /painel
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@example.com')
        

        # -> Retry login by re-inputting password and clicking login button or investigate unexpected content
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('adminpassword')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the login button to submit login form again
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Admin Panel UI Components Rendered Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The admin painel UI components did not render or function correctly across different screen sizes and browsers as per the test plan.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC009-Data consistency between frontend display and backend persistence after edits
description: Verify that any edits made through the admin editors immediately reflect in the backend Supabase data and on the public website without discrepancies.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/painel", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input email and password to login and access the admin editors.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input admin email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@example.com')
        

        # -> Click the 'Entrar' button to submit the login form and access the admin dashboard.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Entrar' button to login and access admin editors
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Clear and re-input the password field correctly, then click the 'Entrar' button to login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Clear the password field to ensure no hidden input issues
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input admin password correctly
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('adminpassword')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Entrar' button to login after re-inputting password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Content synchronization successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test failed: Edits made through admin editors did not immediately reflect in the backend Supabase data and public website as required by the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC010-Error handling when Supabase service is unavailable
description: Simulate Supabase service downtime or failures and verify that the admin painel gracefully handles errors during content fetching or saving without crashing.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/painel", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input valid credentials and click login to access the admin painel.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@example.com')
        

        # -> Click the Entrar button to login and access the admin painel.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input valid password and click Entrar button to login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('adminpassword')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Entrar button to login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Supabase service is fully operational').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test failed: Supabase service downtime simulation detected. The admin painel did not handle errors gracefully during content fetching or saving, leading to test failure as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
